title: Thinderbird importing Inbox sub folders
content: Migrating from an old laptop to a new one. Tried using "Import/Export" utility but the resulting .zip file is too large (~4.0gb). We got the bare bones Inbox folder but none of the sub-folders. How can I copy them over to the new machine if the Import Manager won't recognize the .zip file?
creator: turbo4kq

creator: billlavalee

title: How do I set up multiple users on same email account, multiple computers
content:
I have seen lots of questions with the opposite tack. If there is already an answer here, I apologize for not finding it and asking again.

I support a small business. The main email address is office@<mydomain>.com. Three of us monitor that account, on three separate computers. We have always struggled with not knowing if one of the others already responded to an email or not. This has led to us either spamming the person submitting the inquiry, or all of us "ignoring" it by assuming someone else responded.

Is there a way for Thunderbird to monitor and indicate if the email was replied to on any of the systems, not just the one we're sitting in front of? We own the domain and host our email server through inmotion hosting, which gives us lots of control if something needs to be configured server-side.
creator: office743

title: Message filters - no Sieve support?
content: I found an outdated add-on for Sieve. Is there any other way around or official support for Sieve?

title: thunderbird filter selector dropdowns freeze
content:
I am often getting a freeze when selecting a folder to copy/move mail to, when creating a filter.

Happens when I accidentally highlight a wrong item in the drop down box, and try to move the pointer to the correct item which is immediately above or below the highlighted item. There is no mouse click yet.

Tbird takes too long to back out of my error. It SHOULD allow me to simply move to the correct item

Keith Bainbridge keithrbaulaptop@gmail.com
creator: keithrbaulaptop

title: Need help finding & installing TB v 31.8.0
content:
I need to download & install TB ver 31.8.0 to a newly installed system running ubuntu 22.04.

My earler installation of TB 31.8.0 on my other computer has critical information on it, running under ubuntu 14.04. It's so old that i cannot access the internet on it.

So I'm hoping to install TB 31.8.0 on this new computer, copy my TB profile from my old computer to this new computer, then do the necessary updates to this newly installed version of TB 31.8.0 to bring it up to TB vers 115

Thanks in advance!
creator: thedudeabides2011

title: Installazione  Thunderbird
content: Buongiorno, avevo installato Thunderbird ma dopo averlo configurato non funzionava, così ho eliminato le cartelle del profilo per poterne creare uno nuovo ma a questo punto non mi si apriva più il programma, allora ho deciso di disinstallare tutto dal pannello di controllo e reinstallare scaricando di nuovo il file di esecuzione. A questo punto il messaggio del programma era sempre lo stesso e cioè che non poteva accedere al mio profilo e non si apriva per poterci lavorare o comunque per cambiare impostazioni ecc. Grazie mille
creator: jonnyspini79

title: backup emails
content: Hi. I am currently in the process of switching to another email provider. I have emails in my inbox that are really important and dating back to 2018. I really don't want to lose these when I switch the settings, but I have no idea how to download/back up all my emails. How can I back them up and then import them after I switch the server settings.
creator: Isaac12

title: Emails Lost When Thunderbird Crashed Mid Download
content:
Hello, I have Thunderbird set up to download emails from my isp, and it's set up to clear the messages from the web server once downloaded. I check my messages on the isp webmail service during the day, so I know roughly how many messages will be downloading when I run Thunderbird.

Last night Thunderbird crashed midway through downloading emails and it took several attempts to reopen it. When I did get back in emails from the past 3 days are not in the inbox, but they have been deleted from the web server. They weren't in the deleted folder when I checked.

I contacted my isp to ask if they could recover the emails, but they didn't think they could with the emails having been deleted from the server.

I'm unable to confirm if the emails did download but they were removed from the web server so I wanted to know if there was any way to recover them within Thunderbird? Thanks in advance
creator: david801

title: Problems with resetting up accounts after Thunderbird crashed. One eventually reappeared but the second one will not.Message is 'incoming server already exists! I used ot have both side by side!
content: I have been usibg Thunderbird to manage mail, calendar, contacts since Nov 2022 with little problem. Suddenly the two email addresses disappeared. I have followed all the help I found on this forum - uninstalling Thunderbird, re-installing and re-entering the IMAP details. One account - after receiving the message - 'incoming server already exists' in a loop - suddenly populated the address. I cannot get the second one to get past the same message - and all the folders I had set up are gone. Please advise what is the issue. I am using Windows 11 and the emails are gmail.Thank you!
creator: SuziM
